body:
College Life….

Hey everyone, I want to say my deepest apologies to you guys. When I went to college I planned on writing and keeping up with everything but that did not happen. I hope to write again soon, my spring semester is a lot lighter than my fall one. I hope you all can forgive me, I was able to get a 4.0 tho.

I plan to start writing everyone’s requests very shortly, probably before I go back and have it posted on Friday or Saturday.

Again I am soo sorry… I hope you all understand that I put my education first.

I want to thank everyone who still is liking and rebloging and commenting on my fics

^not my gif

title: call me son one more time
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2FgNto0

by Nohalfway

“Peter,” Steve said, “I am-”

“Not my fucking dad,” Peter hissed, “just because you’re fucking my dad doesn’t make you my parent, I don’t want you here, I never even fucking liked you,” he knew all of his weak spots and attacked them as hard as he could, “I only pretended to to make my actual dad happy, the news was right about you, you’re not even hero, just go already.” He spun on his heel and slammed the door, leaving Steve staring at the door.

superfam just needs to talk to each other

tags: They Wasted a Perfectly Good Plot
They Wasted a Perfectly Good Character
summary: I’ve come to an interesting, and ultimately sad, realization. (Negativity under the cut, Lea fans not advised to read)[[MORE]]...
body:
I’ve come to an interesting, and ultimately sad, realization.

(Negativity under the cut, Lea fans not advised to read)

Kairi in Kingdom Hearts and Kingdom Hearts II perfectly parallels Mary Jane Watson as played by Kirsten Dunst in Spider-Man and Spider-Man 2. I’m dead serious, just consider:

In the first installment, they are the hero’s red-headed love interest who only ever has scenes that are from the hero’s POV. And yet despite this, and despite what misogynistic asshat fans claim, they are much more than just damsels in distress (heck, Kairi arguably isn’t even a damsel in distress given that she was kept safe within Sora’s heart all along and even ends up saving him) - they both have three-dimensional, human, relatable personalities and actual character arcs related to their own backstories and personal desires unrelated to the hero.

In the second installment, they are older and stronger and even receive scenes without the hero…but sadly, all of their scenes, even the ones they have by themselves, are always focused on their role as the hero’s love interest. Any personal arc they might have is sidelined in favor of their feelings for the hero. MJ is improved upon in the novelization, though, and Kairi is improved upon in (*looks at KH2′s novelization* ………..) er, the manga adaptation. 

So that means in the third installment, Kairi will follow MJ’s lead and get to have the best of both worlds: a character arc focused on her own desires apart from the hero, where she gets to have scenes on her own that focus on that arc and not on the hero, that allow her to be as fully fleshed-out and humanly flawed as the hero. It will be her strongest showing to date.

HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA - no. That is almost definitely NOT what we’ll be getting in Kingdom Hearts III. In Dream Drop Distance, a perfectly good chance for an arc for Kairi was instead given to Lea, and in KH3, every scene she doesn’t have with Sora seems to be shared with Lea and is all for the sake of him and his development. Kairi is merely his prop, as is Xion by extension - props used for his “redemption arc” and his role in KH3 as a “hero”.

Fuck Lea. I literally cannot understate at this point how much I can’t stand this character.

And since he’s the one responsible, fuck Tetsuya Nomura too!

I’ve come to an interesting, and ultimately sad, realization.

(Negativity under the cut, Lea fans not advised to read)

title: Ready for Endgame: Iron Man & The Incedible Hulk
body:
I’m rewatching The MCU, because you know, Endgame.

OK, so, I know we tried this last year and we didn’t get anywhere with it. But this time I have a schedule and a plan, and I’m determined. I am rewatching the MCU and I am writing about it! (HOORAY!)

So, we’re starting at the beginning, whenever possible I’m going to do 2 movies per post with each Avengers movie getting their own post. A few, just by virtue of timing will be getting solo posts.

F…

summary: Where Good Girls Go To Die 25/29
title: Where Good Girls Go To Die 25/29
body:
Pairing: MC!Tattoo Artist!Peter Parker x Barton!Reader

Warning: Angst. Revenge. Swearing. Lust. Jealousy. Snarkiness. Overprotectiveness. Pinning. Mild Cheating. Guilt. Anger. Confusion.

A/N: Look this is more gritty, dirty and adult than I have wrote, but I’m excited about this. There is a mild moment of cheating and no it’s not condoned. Just know if you aren’t for that moment, don’t ask to be tagged.

[Synopsis Has Been Removed]

Only Four Parts Left Peaches!!!

Y/N Barton

You woke in your bed at Clint’s. You grumble, rubbing your eyes, you rip the blankets off and stumble out of bed. When you pull open your door, you gasp, stepping back. A wall of thick plastic cups were stacked on top of one another, filling your doorway. It came up to your chin and left no room for escape.

“What in the fuck?” You yell, stomping your foot. “Clint?” You demand. A chuckle follows your yelling.

“Good morning.” Peter smirks as he steps into the living room. He looked rather pleased with himself.

“Why are you here so early?” You gasp. You yank your T-shirt farther down your legs. “And what in the actual fuck?” You wave your free hand at the cups.

“Just making sure you didn’t run.” He smirks, sipping from the coffee mug in his hands.

“I have a window.” You smirk at him.

“Yeah I gorilla glued that shut while you were showering last night.” Clint chuckles as he walks by. You gasp loudly. You look at the wall of cups, it was going to be loud and noisy if you knocked them down. You smack center of the cup wall and they all go tumbling to the floor. Bouncing and banging around loudly.

“I hate you, both of you.” You attempt to head for the bathroom, you stumble and trip on a few of the cups.

“You never were much of a morning person.” Peter chuckles watching you still. You pick up a cup, whipping it at him. It slams into his chest.

“Fuck off.” You turn heading into the bathroom.

“Remember you signed up for this. You’re stupid.” Clint chuckles, pouring coffee.

“She loves me, she just has to get over everything.” Peter nods. “She has to stop thinking I’m going to hurt her again.” He sighs. You come out of the bathroom, picking up another cup, you throw it at him, this time it hits the back of his head. “Ow.” He turns glaring at you as you head into your room, kicking the door shut.

“Looks to be going good.” Clint laughs.

“We’ll get there. We keep ending up together.” Peter chuckles.

You dress quickly, you were going to have to deal with Peter all day if you were going to work, but you could continue to ignore him the best you were. You knew you were just mad, you knew you wanted to forgive Peter, but how do you just let go of five years of anger and pain with the snap of your fingers?





You yank the door open, strolling out, Peter looks you over a smirk on his lips. You wore ripped jeans, your sheer, thick strap tank top was white, the bottom rested on your jeans and the arm openings were cut low exposing your tattoo. You wore a bralette underneath, it covered portions of your tattoo, but most of it was on display. You pull your sneakers on before you realize they both are staring at you.

“I’m going to work, but do not expect me to be nice today.” You shrug.

“What do you mean? You’re not a ray of sunshine?” Clint calls as you head out the door. You could hear them laughing.

“What in the fuck?!” You yell for the third time that morning. A big yellow metal thing was on the front tire of your car.

“I put a boot on her car.” Peter chuckles as they follow you out of the house.

“Nice.” Clint nods, grinning. Your mouth smashes together as you glare at them.

“You’re riding with me, Darlin’.” Peter ushers you towards his truck.

“You’re so annoying!” You pout, as he helps you into the truck.

“In you go.” He smiles, before shutting the door and coming around to get in on his side.

“I really hate you.” You sigh, shaking your head.

“That’s a shame.” Peter sighs, looking over at you as he starts his truck. “Cause damn do I love you Darlin.” He gives you a small smile. You inwardly curse, as you felt yourself thaw ever so slightly. You roll your eyes looking away from him.






You were kicked back on Nat’s chair, she was sketching at her desk.

“So how long are you going to be mad?” She taps the pencil against the desk.

“I’m not really even mad.” You sigh. “I’m, I don’t know.” You stare up at the ceiling.

“It’s called scared.” She smirks over at you.

“I never in my life thought I’d be scared of Peter.” You mutter, running your fingers through your hair letting it fall over the edge of the chair.

“So why are you?” Nat rolls over towards you.

“Because something always comes between us.” You sigh, rolling your eyes. You roll on to your side, facing her.

“Always? Lying slutty ex, cheating twat. Hmm, seems like it’s just woman.” She sasses.

“My brother.” You sass back.

“Oh no, no, you can’t use him as an excuse.” She shakes her head. “He knew and never stopped the two of you.” She points a finger at you.

“I don’t know, Nat.” You groan, rolling back over on to your back.

“I think you do. There are always going to be woman that want him, or men that want you.” She shrugs as your head rolls to the side to look at her. “But from what I’ve seen you’re a force to be reckon with. Take what you want and take no mercy.” She shrugs. You weren’t sure it was ever going to be that easy with you and Peter. How the hell were you just supposed to pretend the last five years didn’t happen?

“Is it really that easy?” You sigh.

“Why can’t it be?” She snorts. “Don’t start over, pick up where you left off. You can’t re-fall in love with each other when you never stopped. So starting over will do nothing for you. Jump in head first, cause you know Peter is going to do anything he has to, too keep you.” She grins. You couldn’t really disagree with her. Being with Peter was like picking up right where you left off.

“Y/N!” Buck yells, suddenly. You and Nat exchange a look, before you both look at the closed door.

“Y/N!?” Peter yells, seconds later he throws open Nat’s door. He’s breathing a little heavy, his face pale.

“Boys.” Nat smirks.

“You’re looking pale.” You smirk at Peter, as Buck joins him in the doorway.

“What’s going on?” Nat grins.

“Couldn’t find you.” Peter clears his throat, trying to look a little more put together.

“We were just talking about taking one of those pole dancing classes.” Nat grins wider. Buck and Peter’s faces fall slack instantly.

“You learn a lot of tricks.” You nod, pushing yourself up off the chair.

“We should sign up.” Nat looks over at you.

“What?” Peter’s voice cracks.

“Pole dancing?” Buck’s brow pulls down. You move towards the door, your hand lands on Peter’s chest. You grin.

“Breathe, it’s not stripping.” You give a small laugh. Nat stops behind you.

“It’s like stripping for the shy.” She winks. Your hand trails down Peter’s chest before you completely drop it and slip past them with Nat.

“Hey, whoa!” Peter yells suddenly following.

“What?” Buck looks confused as he follows after.

trail.content_raw:
Pairing: MC!Tattoo Artist!Peter Parker x Barton!Reader

Warning: Angst. Revenge. Swearing. Lust. Jealousy. Snarkiness. Overprotectiveness. Pinning. Mild Cheating. Guilt. Anger. Confusion.

A/N: Look this is more gritty, dirty and adult than I have wrote, but I’m excited about this. There is a mild moment of cheating and no it’s not condoned. Just know if you aren’t for that moment, don’t ask to be tagged.

[Synopsis Has Been Removed]

Only Four Parts Left Peaches!!!

[[MORE]]

Y/N Barton

You woke in your bed at Clint’s. You grumble, rubbing your eyes, you rip the blankets off and stumble out of bed. When you pull open your door, you gasp, stepping back. A wall of thick plastic cups were stacked on top of one another, filling your doorway. It came up to your chin and left no room for escape.

“What in the fuck?” You yell, stomping your foot. “Clint?” You demand. A chuckle follows your yelling.

“Good morning.” Peter smirks as he steps into the living room. He looked rather pleased with himself.

“Why are you here so early?” You gasp. You yank your T-shirt farther down your legs. “And what in the actual fuck?” You wave your free hand at the cups.

“Just making sure you didn’t run.” He smirks, sipping from the coffee mug in his hands.

“I have a window.” You smirk at him.

“Yeah I gorilla glued that shut while you were showering last night.” Clint chuckles as he walks by. You gasp loudly. You look at the wall of cups, it was going to be loud and noisy if you knocked them down. You smack center of the cup wall and they all go tumbling to the floor. Bouncing and banging around loudly.

“I hate you, both of you.” You attempt to head for the bathroom, you stumble and trip on a few of the cups.

“You never were much of a morning person.” Peter chuckles watching you still. You pick up a cup, whipping it at him. It slams into his chest.

“Fuck off.” You turn heading into the bathroom.

“Remember you signed up for this. You’re stupid.” Clint chuckles, pouring coffee.

“She loves me, she just has to get over everything.” Peter nods. “She has to stop thinking I’m going to hurt her again.” He sighs. You come out of the bathroom, picking up another cup, you throw it at him, this time it hits the back of his head. “Ow.” He turns glaring at you as you head into your room, kicking the door shut.

“Looks to be going good.” Clint laughs.

“We’ll get there. We keep ending up together.” Peter chuckles.

You dress quickly, you were going to have to deal with Peter all day if you were going to work, but you could continue to ignore him the best you were. You knew you were just mad, you knew you wanted to forgive Peter, but how do you just let go of five years of anger and pain with the snap of your fingers?





You yank the door open, strolling out, Peter looks you over a smirk on his lips. You wore ripped jeans, your sheer, thick strap tank top was white, the bottom rested on your jeans and the arm openings were cut low exposing your tattoo. You wore a bralette underneath, it covered portions of your tattoo, but most of it was on display. You pull your sneakers on before you realize they both are staring at you.

“I’m going to work, but do not expect me to be nice today.” You shrug.

“What do you mean? You’re not a ray of sunshine?” Clint calls as you head out the door. You could hear them laughing.

“What in the fuck?!” You yell for the third time that morning. A big yellow metal thing was on the front tire of your car.

“I put a boot on her car.” Peter chuckles as they follow you out of the house.

“Nice.” Clint nods, grinning. Your mouth smashes together as you glare at them.

“You’re riding with me, Darlin’.” Peter ushers you towards his truck.

“You’re so annoying!” You pout, as he helps you into the truck.

“In you go.” He smiles, before shutting the door and coming around to get in on his side.

“I really hate you.” You sigh, shaking your head.

“That’s a shame.” Peter sighs, looking over at you as he starts his truck. “Cause damn do I love you Darlin.” He gives you a small smile. You inwardly curse, as you felt yourself thaw ever so slightly. You roll your eyes looking away from him.






You were kicked back on Nat’s chair, she was sketching at her desk.

“So how long are you going to be mad?” She taps the pencil against the desk.

“I’m not really even mad.” You sigh. “I’m, I don’t know.” You stare up at the ceiling.

“It’s called scared.” She smirks over at you.

“I never in my life thought I’d be scared of Peter.” You mutter, running your fingers through your hair letting it fall over the edge of the chair.

“So why are you?” Nat rolls over towards you.

“Because something always comes between us.” You sigh, rolling your eyes. You roll on to your side, facing her.

“Always? Lying slutty ex, cheating twat. Hmm, seems like it’s just woman.” She sasses.

“My brother.” You sass back.

“Oh no, no, you can’t use him as an excuse.” She shakes her head. “He knew and never stopped the two of you.” She points a finger at you.

“I don’t know, Nat.” You groan, rolling back over on to your back.

“I think you do. There are always going to be woman that want him, or men that want you.” She shrugs as your head rolls to the side to look at her. “But from what I’ve seen you’re a force to be reckon with. Take what you want and take no mercy.” She shrugs. You weren’t sure it was ever going to be that easy with you and Peter. How the hell were you just supposed to pretend the last five years didn’t happen?

“Is it really that easy?” You sigh.

“Why can’t it be?” She snorts. “Don’t start over, pick up where you left off. You can’t re-fall in love with each other when you never stopped. So starting over will do nothing for you. Jump in head first, cause you know Peter is going to do anything he has to, too keep you.” She grins. You couldn’t really disagree with her. Being with Peter was like picking up right where you left off.

“Y/N!” Buck yells, suddenly. You and Nat exchange a look, before you both look at the closed door.

“Y/N!?” Peter yells, seconds later he throws open Nat’s door. He’s breathing a little heavy, his face pale.

“Boys.” Nat smirks.

“You’re looking pale.” You smirk at Peter, as Buck joins him in the doorway.

“What’s going on?” Nat grins.

“Couldn’t find you.” Peter clears his throat, trying to look a little more put together.

“We were just talking about taking one of those pole dancing classes.” Nat grins wider. Buck and Peter’s faces fall slack instantly.

“You learn a lot of tricks.” You nod, pushing yourself up off the chair.

“We should sign up.” Nat looks over at you.

“What?” Peter’s voice cracks.

“Pole dancing?” Buck’s brow pulls down. You move towards the door, your hand lands on Peter’s chest. You grin.

“Breathe, it’s not stripping.” You give a small laugh. Nat stops behind you.

“It’s like stripping for the shy.” She winks. Your hand trails down Peter’s chest before you completely drop it and slip past them with Nat.

“Hey, whoa!” Peter yells suddenly following.

“What?” Buck looks confused as he follows after.
